name: Bill Gates
description: A laptop won’t revolutionize the minutiae of your life the way a smartphone can. You can’t easily whip one out to kill time in the elevator, capture a breathtaking sunset, or pay for a cup of coffee.But in the years since smartphones took on all these jobs.

name: Stave Jobs
description: As a tech junkie, my relationship with technology goes back to my childhood years. Getting my first Intel Pentium 4 PC was the start of journey that would eventually bring me to Notebookcheck

name: mark zuckerberg
description: first stepped into the wondrous IT&C world when I was around seven years old. I was instantly fascinated by computerized graphics, whether they were from games or 3D applications like 3D Max. I'm also an avid reader of science fiction

name: barak obama
description: astrophysics aficionado, and a crypto geek. I started writing PC-related articles for Softpedia and a few blogs back in 2006. I joined the Notebookcheck team in the summer of 2017 and am currently a senior tech writer mostly covering processor, GPU, and laptop news.

name: Donald Trump
description: Pretty nonsense comparison. They should also include computation per watt. Then ryzen is still the better option.

name: Emma watson
description: What is the point of a small benchmark win, if after few seconds the laptop starts thermal throtlling or it runs out of battery much faster??
